In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    new_words = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(new_words, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(new_words, current_line) # append the remaining line after the loop
    return join(new_words, "\n")  # return as a single string with new lines between each word
end
```

An example to use this function:

```julia
s = "This is an example of text wrapping. The words are separated by spaces and it will wrap after the maximum width."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will return a string where each line does not exceed `text_width`. In this case, `text_width` is set to 10 so it wraps after every 10 characters.
